title: The analysis of job satisfaction of young lecturers of private universities in Surabaya
abstract: The research is done to examine the simultaneous and individual impact of the components of intrinsic and extrinsic motivations on job satisfaction of young lecturers in private universities in Surabaya. Multiple regressions were used as the analysis technique to reveal the relationship between them. The results show that the components of intrinsic and extrinsic factors simultaneously impact job satisfaction of young lecturers of private universities in Surabaya. In addition, the findings show that recognition, working conditions and supervision individually has impact on the job satisfaction of the young lecturers in private universities in Surabaya.
contributors: Ricky Wang (Advisor 1); Juliana Caesaria Tandung (Examination Committee 1)
source: Undergraduate Thesis No. 34010276/MAN/2016; Gracia Stefani Tjoe (34412072)
